title: ENR Russia Invest essuie une perte en raison de la chute du rouble
cleaned_sentences: ZURICH (AWP) - The participation company ENR Russia Invest wiped a net loss of 7.95 million Swiss francs last year, which it explains with the tumble of the ruble.
The Russian currency has indeed depreciated 35% compared to the franc in 2023, the company located in Geneva on Tuesday.
In 2022, the company had managed to finish the exercise at balance, with a gain of 0.18 million.
The sanctions against Russia weigh, even if Enr Russia ensures that operational activities, focused on the Russian internal market, continue to be well.
However, fund transfers are difficult due to regulatory constraints within banks and the trading in stocks and bonds remains blocked.
No dividend will be paid under the year 2023, as in 2022.
The company claims to keep the eye on the evolution of the geopolitical situation to make the necessary decisions.
ENR Russia is mainly held by Valartis with a share of 63%.
